entry.title: Schedule RAP Service in BTP Job Scheduler
entry.content:
We have a ABAP cloud system where we have a created a RAP Application. Its a very basic app with a GET operation only.
Our main agenda is to explore the usage of BTP Job scheduler. I am aware that CAPM application can be scheduled easily in Job scheduler.

Kindly let me know if it is possible to schedule RAP Service as a job in Job scheduler. If yes, please help with some working steps for the same.

entry.title: Are any RAP BO Reflection APIs available in BTP ABAP environment?
entry.content:
Hello, colleagues. 

Does anyone know any cloud ready reflection API for RAP BO? Are there any plans to make any reflection API for RAP BO?

By the way, class CL_ABAP_BEHVDESCR doesn't have release contract and I can't use it.  Also, the class seems not fully comply with my tasks (read all action for BDEF).

Futhermore, I've tried XCO library, it has quite poor reading capabilities. XCO generation part doesn't give possibility to study existing BDEF at all. Also I've tried classes for abapGIT serialization, I wasn't successful too(not released).

If you know the API, please point out how to get all actions defined in BDEF. 

P.S. It would be great to get something really powerfull to read and parse all BDEF, to get all nodes or all RAP actions or RAP functions etc.

entry.title: How to prevent deletion of specific entry in Event 03 (Table Maintenance) when choose multiple rows
entry.content:
Hi experts, I am using Event 03: Before Deleting the Data for my table ZSAP03_EMAIL Now I write this FORM to prevent user from deleting user with USER_ID = DEV-145. When I delete a line with DEV-145 the system works correctly, but when I select multiple lines, including DEV-145 the system deletes DEV-145 as well. Please give me detailed solutions

 

FORM on_delete.
FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_user_id> TYPE any.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'USER_ID' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_user_id>.

IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_user_id> = 'DEV-145'.

MESSAGE 'Default row DEV-145 cannot be deleted!' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Possibility for Mass Production Order Confirmation in Foreground from template in SAP Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a requirement, where users perform "Mass Confirmation of production order's" through Excel template. Also, the confirmation screen - CO11N have certain validations (using Badi) in place for the order to be confirmed.

Each order is confirmed in foreground, allowing users to manipulate "Goods movement data - yield Qty, posting date, Storage location, Execution date, Component Qty" to be within validations placed. This is possible in ECC.

Requirement in Public cloud system:

1) User should be able to upload list of Production orders with other info through Template.

2) User should perform confirmation in the foreground with data picked from template and also allowing to change on screen confirmation data.

Has anyone achieved or any possible leads for the same to be replicated in SAP Public Cloud environment?

Thankyou.

entry.title: How to automatically assign a business role in BTP ABAP environment via IPS
entry.content:
Hi experts,

we have set up user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services and our BTP ABAP environment. This is working perfectly fine.

Now we want to automatically assign the business users in the BTP ABAP environment to certain business roles based on the group assignment in the Cloud Identity Services via IPS.

Example:

All users assinged to group "BTP ABAP Environment Admins" (with technical ID "abap_admins") in IAS should be assigned to business role "Administrator" (with technical ID "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR")

The basic transformation of the target BTP ABAP environment system in IPS is as follows:

{
	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%a4c.roles.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%a4c.roles.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",
		"mappings": [
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.userName",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.externalId",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['employeeNumber']",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.personID",
				"sourceVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.markedForArchivingIndicator",
				"constant": "false"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",
				"targetPath": "$.user.globalUserID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePaths": [
					"$.userType"
				],
				"targetPath": "$.businessPartnerRoleCode",
				"valueMappings": [
					{
						"key": [
							"Employee"
						],
						"mappedValue": "BUP003"
					}
				],
				"type": "valueMapping",
				"defaultValue": "BUP003"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.validityPeriod.startDate",
				"sourceVariable": "currentDate",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.validityPeriod.endDate",
				"constant": "9999-12-31",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.validityPeriod.startDate",
				"sourceVariable": "currentDate",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.validityPeriod.endDate",
				"constant": "9999-12-31",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.givenName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.firstName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.familyName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.lastName"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.middleName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.middleName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.formatted",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.personFullName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.userName",
				"targetPath": "$.user.userName"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.locale",
				"targetPath": "$.user.logonLanguageCode",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.emails[0].value",
				"targetPath": "$.workplaceInformation.emailAddress"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.lockedIndicator",
				"condition": "$.active == false",
				"constant": "true"
			}
		]
	},
	"group": {
		"condition": "isAttributeWithOptionalPrefix($.displayName, a4c.roles.prefix) && isAttributeWithOptionalPrefix($['urn:sap:cloud:scim:schemas:extension:custom:2.0:Group']['name'], a4c.roles.prefix) && (isRegularGroup() || isApplicationSpecificGroup())",
		"mappings": [
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.displayName",
				"targetVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem",
				"scope": "createEntity",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceFirstString",
						"condition": "isAttributeWithMandatoryPrefix(@, a4c.roles.prefix)",
						"regex": "%a4c.roles.prefix%",
						"replacement": ""
					}
				]
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.displayName",
				"targetPath": "$.displayName",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceFirstString",
						"condition": "isAttributeWithMandatoryPrefix(@, a4c.roles.prefix)",
						"regex": "%a4c.roles.prefix%",
						"replacement": ""
					}
				]
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.members[*].value",
				"targetPath": "$.members[?(@.value)]",
				"optional": true,
				"preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "resolveEntityIds"
					}
				]
			}
		]
	}
}

Below "user" > "mappings" we added following configuration:

{
	"condition": "$.groups[?(@.value == 'abap_admins')] empty false",
	"targetPath": "$.user.userRoleAssignments[0].businessRole",
	"constant": "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR"
}

We also tried following:

{
	"condition": "$.groups[?(@.value == 'abap_admins')] empty false",
	"targetPath": "$.user.businessRoles[0].roleID",
	"constant": "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR"
}

Unfortunately none is working.

How can I automatically assign business roles in the BTP ABAP environment using SAP IPS?

 

regards

René

entry.title: Managed with additional save with full data implemenation data saves in DB and disappears in few sec
entry.content:
Hi Team ,

1. I was trying to create a simple report with the combination of Billing hearder and item details wtih custom table .

2. An action button for selecting the record and process it ...on processing custom logic we need to save the updated value as per the logic and save in the custom table ( means updating the custom table with new value ).

while doing so value getting saved in the custom table but disappears in few seconds . i am unable to figure out where went wrong here is the code snippet below 

define bheavior with cds view comibation of standard and custom table with persistan custom table and mapping the custom 

On action button code logic to process the new value

READ ENTITIES OF XXXX IN LOCAL MODE ENTITY XXX ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
RESULT DATA(lt_xxx)

 
LOOP AT lt_XXX ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_XXX>).
        <fs_XXX>-field1   = lw_Wa-field1.
        <fs_XXX>-field2   = lw_Wa-field2.
       <fs_XXX>-field3   = lw_Wa-field3.
ENDLOOP.
 

MODIFY ENTITIES OF XXXX IN LOCAL MODE ENTITY XXX
UPDATE FIELDS (field1 field2 field3 )
WITH VALUE #( FOR lw_key IN lt_t1
(           %key-key1 = lw_key-%key-key1
            %key-key2 = lw_key-%key-key2

field1 = lw_key-field1
field1 = lw_key-field1
field1 = lw_key-field1
) )
FAILED DATA(lt_failed)
REPORTED DATA(lt_reported)
MAPPED DATA(lt_mapped).

read table lt_xxx INTO DATA(ls_xxx) index 1.

INSERT VALUE #(
%tky = ls_keys-%tky
%param = ls_xxx ) INTO TABLE result.

and in save_modified method.

LOOP AT update-XXX INTO DATA(ls_XXX).
CLEAR lt_ewayt3_u[].

lw_ewayt3-key1 = ls_update-key1.
lw_ewayt3-key2 = ls_update-key2.
lw_ewayt3-field1 = ls_update-field1.
lw_ewayt3-field2 = ls_update-field2.
lw_ewayt3-field3 = ls_update-field3.

APPEND ls_XXX TO lt_u.

UPDATE zxxx FROM TABLE @ lt_u.

its saving the value in the DB but disappears again.

please suggest me where it wrong 
ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Integration with SuccessFactors lms table and ui5 Application
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

My requirement is to create simple ui5 application to record external training events and the record should be saved to SuccessFactors lms table through the Api call,
i have developed the ui and called the Api but not able to save the data in the lms table, Im using btp environment and trying to setup the destination configuration but not sure what the missing part, I'm Not having much exposure in btp , so currently stuck here, I have bought our sf url and token service url from sf team, do i need any additional info from them ? is there anything to do to consume the configured destination to access with in the business application studio

  var oPayload = {
                "learningEventRecords": [
                    {
                        "learningEvent": {
                            "title": sTitle,
                            "description": sDescription,
                            "completionDate": sCompletionDate, // format YYYY-MM-DD or as required
                            "totalHours": fTotalHours,
                            "creditHours": fCreditHours,
                            "provider": sProvider,
                            "format": sFormat,
                            "category": sCategory
                            // Add other required fields here
                        }
                    }
                ]
            };

            // API URL - replace with your actual endpoint URL
            var sUrl = "SF_Learning_API/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningEvent/v1/recordLearningEvents";

            // AJAX POST call
            $.ajax({
                url: sUrl,
                method: "POST",
                contentType: "application/json",
                data: JSON.stringify(oPayload),
                headers: {
                    // Add authorization header if needed, e.g.:
                    // "Authorization": "Bearer " + yourAccessToken
                },
                success: function (oData, textStatus, jqXHR) {
                    sap.m.MessageToast.show("Learning event recorded successfully!");
                },
                error: function (jqXHR, textStatus, errorThrown) {
                    sap.m.MessageBox.error("Error recording learning event: " + jqXHR.responseText);
                }
            });

entry.title: 🧵CL_SALV_TABLE — Seleção com ROW_COLUMN não mantém referência na impressão
entry.content:
💡 Dica útil

💥Ocorreu após a migração ECC / S4 💥

Hoje me deparei com um comportamento curioso usando SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) no CL_SALV_TABLE. Ao tentar imprimir as linhas selecionadas com:

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).
lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).


"Notei que a referência da seleção se perdia após o usuário clicar em 'Imprimir' e, depois, executar alguma rotina que dependia da seleção de linhas. As linhas selecionadas não eram preservadas como esperado. Testei trocar para:"

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

🟢 Troquei para MULTIPLE e resolveu! As linhas selecionadas passaram a ser capturadas certinho na impressão. Fica a dica: se você precisa garantir que a seleção funcione como esperado, esse modo é muito mais confiável.
⚠️ Vale lembrar que a CL_SALV_TABLE não tem suporte direto pra capturar colunas selecionadas — diferente da CL_GUI_ALV_GRID, que dá bem mais controle nesse ponto. Então, se você precisa dessa precisão, talvez seja hora de considerar a migração.
Alguém aí já passou por isso? Encontrou alguma solução criativa ou outro caminho pra contornar? Compartilha aí!

entry.title: 🧵CL_SALV_TABLE — Lost selection reference when printing using ROW_COLUMN
entry.content:
“Problem occurred after ECC/S4 migration.

Today I ran into a strange behavior while using SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) in CL_SALV_TABLE. When trying to print selected rows using:

 

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).

lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).

🚨 I noticed that the selection reference was lost — selected columns weren’t preserved as expected. I switched to:

 

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

 

🟢 That did the trick! The selected rows were printed correctly, even when using the Quartz theme (which doesn’t visually show the selection column). So here’s the tip: if you need reliable selection tracking, the MULTIPLE mode is much more stable.

🔍 Unfortunately, CL_SALV_TABLE doesn’t offer a way to retrieve selected columns like CL_GUI_ALV_GRID does. If you need that level of detail, it might be worth considering a migration.

Has anyone else faced this? Got workarounds to share? Let’s talk! 💬

 

Se quiser posso transformar isso num carrossel pra LinkedIn ou formatar com visuais. Só dar o toque, Felipe! 👨‍💻💡

entry.title: Amount in Words in Indian Currency Format in Adobe Form (Check Printing)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have developed a check printing Adobe Form. Currently, the "Amount in Words" field is showing values in Million and Billion format e.g., One Million Rupees. But we need it in the Indian currency format e.g., Ten Lakh Rupees.

We do not have a data source for the form, so I tried to implement the conversion using JavaScript in the form itself.

But this script is not triggering during runtime like when the form runs from SAP. It works in the preview, but not in the live execution.

Can someone guide:

  • How to trigger JavaScript correctly during runtime?

  • Or how to bind a custom script to convert amount to Indian words in Adobe forms?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Scheduling Background Jobs Using Application Job Templates
entry.content:
Introduction

In traditional ECC systems, developers typically used SUBMIT statements or function modules like JOB_OPEN, JOB_SUBMIT, and JOB_CLOSE to schedule background jobs. However, with the evolution of SAP to the S/4HANA Cloud and SAP BTP (ABAP Environment), the mechanism for job scheduling has changed significantly. The new paradigm revolves around Application Job Templates and the Application Job Framework (AJF).

Job Scheduling in ECC

In ECC, background jobs were generally handled through one of the following methods:

  • SUBMIT statements to run reports in background.
  • Function Modules such as:
  • JOB_OPEN
  • JOB_SUBMIT
  • JOB_CLOSE

    These methods gave developers control over job execution from within custom ABAP programs but were tightly coupled with the underlying system and lacked standardization in a cloud-native context.

The Cloud Paradigm: Application Job Framework (AJF)

In S/4HANA Cloud and ABAP Environment, SAP has introduced the Application Job Framework (AJF). This framework decouples job scheduling from the program logic and provides reusable, standardized, and secure job templates that can be scheduled through Fiori apps or ABAP APIs.

Key elements include:

  • Application Job Templates
  • Application Job Catalog
  • Fiori Apps for job management
  • APIs for scheduling via ABAP classes

Creating a Job Template

Job templates are defined using the 'Manage Application Job Templates' Fiori app. Each template is associated with an ABAP class that implements one or more of the following interfaces:

  • IF_APJ_DT_EXEC_OBJECT: For job design-time metadata
  • IF_APJ_RT_EXEC_OBJECT: For runtime execution

    These templates can then be reused across the system by both end-users and developers.

Scheduling Jobs Programmatically

To schedule jobs in ABAP code, SAP provides the utility class CL_APJ_RT_JOB_SCHEDULING_API. This class allows you to schedule jobs based on the template created in the catalog. Below is a basic example of how to use it:

*ABAP
DATA: LV_JOB_START  TYPE TIMESTAMPL,
               LT_PARAMETERS TYPE APJ_PARAMETERS_T,
               LS_JOB_RESULT TYPE APJ_JOB_RESULT,
               LT_MESSAGES   TYPE BAPIRET2_T.

LV_JOB_START = CL_ABAP_CONTEXT_INFO=>GET_SYSTEM_TIME( ) + 120.
APPEND VALUE #( NAME = 'S_ID' VALUE = 'RUN_ID_123' ) TO LT_PARAMETERS.

TRY.
    CALL METHOD CL_APJ_RT_JOB_SCHEDULING_API=>SCHEDULE_JOB
      EXPORTING
        IV_JOB_CATALOG_TYPE = 'ZMY_JOB_TEMPLATE'
        IV_START_TIME       = LV_JOB_START
        IT_PARAMETERS       = LT_PARAMETERS
      IMPORTING
        ES_JOB_RESULT       = LS_JOB_RESULT
        ET_MESSAGES         = LT_MESSAGES.
  CATCH CX_APJ_BASE INTO DATA(LX_APJ).
    " HANDLE ERRORS
ENDTRY.

Monitoring Jobs

Jobs scheduled using this API can be monitored via the Fiori app 'Monitor Application Jobs'. Here, you can check job status, review logs, and troubleshoot failed runs.

Benefits of Using Application Job Framework

  • Decouples job logic from scheduling logic
  • Reusable and standard job templates
  • Enhances cloud compliance and governance
  • Easy monitoring and error tracking via Fiori UI
  • Secure execution with authorization controls

Conclusion

With the shift to cloud-based ABAP development, it's important to adapt to modern, secure, and standardized approaches. Application Job Framework provides a robust solution for job scheduling needs in S/4HANA Cloud and ABAP Environment. Utilize job templates and `CL_APJ_RT_JOB_SCHEDULING_API` to build scalable and maintainable background processes.

entry.title: RAP: Which Activity (ACTVT) should be used in Access Control for Access Category "Value Help/F4"
entry.content:
Hi all,

in an Authorization Object in ABAP Cloud the Activities are mapped to one of the three Categories "Read", "Write", "Value Help".

The Categories are used in Business catalogs (where "Value Help" is labeled as "F4"), Role/Role Template Assignments, etc.

For Activities there are standard values (see eg onpremise in tables acl_actvt/acl_actvtt): 01 for Create, 02 for Change, 03 for Display, 08 for Delete

03 maps to Access Category Read

01,  02, 08 maps to Write

But there is no obvious activity value for Access Category "Value Help".

What activity do you use for Value Help?

Thanks for suggestions, pointers to documentation, tutorials, etc!

Regards,

  Wolfgang
